Title: Policies for information security
Control Description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.

Title: Information security roles and responsibilities
Control Description: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated according to the organization needs.

Title: Segregation of duties
Control Description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated.

Title: Management responsibilities
Control Description: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organization.

Title: Contact with authorities
Control Description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.

Title: Contact with special interest groups
Control Description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.

Title: Threat intelligence
Control Description: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.

Title: Information security in project management
Control Description: Information security shall be integrated into project management.

Title: Inventory of information and other associated assets
Control Description: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, shall be developed and maintained.

Title: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
Control Description: Rules for the acceptable use and procedures for handling information and other associated assets shall be identified, documented and implemented.

Title: Return of assets
Control Description: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate shall return all the organization’s assets in their possession upon change or termination of their employment, contract or agreement.

Title: Classification of information
Control Description: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.

Title: Labelling of information
Control Description: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization.

Title: Information transfer
Control Description: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements shall be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organization and between the organization and other parties.

Title: Access control
Control Description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.

Title: Identity management
Control Description: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.

Title: Authentication information
Control Description: Allocation and management of authentication information shall be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.

Title: Access rights
Control Description: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organization’s topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.

Title: Information security in supplier relationships
Control Description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier’s products or services.

Title: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
Control Description: Relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.
References: NIS_Compliance_Security_Guidelines_for_OES.pdf (Appendix B - Supply Chain Risk Management), NIS2_NCSC_Conference_2024_Slides.pdf (Slide 12)

Title: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
Control Description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.

Title: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
Control Description: The organization shall regularly monitor, review, evaluate and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery.

Title: Information security for use of cloud services
Control Description: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services shall be established in accordance with the organization’s information security requirements.

Title: Information security incident management planning and preparation
Control Description: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.

Title: Assessment and decision on information security events
Control Description: The organization shall assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorized as information security incidents.

Title: Response to information security incidents
Control Description: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.

Title: Learning from information security incidents
Control Description: Knowledge gained from information security incidents shall be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls.

Title: Collection of evidence
Control Description: The organization shall establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security events.

Title: Information security during disruption
Control Description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.

Title: ICT readiness for business continuity
Control Description: ICT readiness shall be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.

Title: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
Control Description: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organization’s approach to meet these requirements shall be identified, documented and kept up to date.

Title: Intellectual property rights
Control Description: The organization shall implement appropriate procedures to protect intellectual property rights.

Title: Protection of records
Control Description: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release.

Title: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information (PII)
Control Description: The organization shall identify and meet the requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicable laws and regulations and contractual requirements.

Title: Independent review of information security
Control Description: The organization’s approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies shall be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.

Title: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
Control Description: Compliance with the organization’s information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards shall be regularly reviewed.

Title: Documented operating procedures
Control Description: Operating procedures for information processing facilities shall be documented and made available to personnel who need them.

Title: Screening
Control Description: Background verification checks on all candidates shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis, considering laws, regulations, business needs, and perceived risks.

Title: Terms and conditions of employment
Control Description: The employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel’s and the organization’s responsibilities for information security.

Title: Information security awareness, education and training
Control Description: Personnel and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness, education, and training, including updates of the organization's policies and procedures relevant to their job function.

Title: Disciplinary process
Control Description: A disciplinary process shall be formalized and communicated to take action against personnel and others who commit an information security policy violation.

Title: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
Control Description: Information security duties that remain valid after employment ends shall be defined, enforced, and communicated.

Title: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
Control Description: Confidentiality or NDA agreements shall be identified, documented, regularly reviewed, and signed by personnel and other interested parties.

Title: Remote working
Control Description: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed, or stored outside the organization’s premises.

Title: Information security event reporting
Control Description: A mechanism shall be in place for personnel to report observed or suspected security events through appropriate channels.

Title: Physical security perimeters
Control Description: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.

Title: Physical entry
Control Description: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls and access points.

Title: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
Control Description: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and implemented.

Title: Physical security monitoring
Control Description: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.

Title: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
Control Description: Protection against threats such as natural disasters, intentional/unintentional damage shall be designed and implemented.

Title: Working in secure areas
Control Description: Security measures for working in secure areas shall be designed and implemented.

Title: Clear desk and clear screen
Control Description: Clear desk and screen rules shall be defined and enforced for information protection.

Title: Equipment siting and protection
Control Description: Equipment shall be sited securely and protected.

Title: Security of assets off-premises
Control Description: Off-site assets shall be protected.

Title: Storage media
Control Description: Managed through their life cycle: acquisition, use, transport, disposal based on classification and handling needs.

Title: Supporting utilities
Control Description: Facilities protected from power failures and service disruptions.

Title: Cabling security
Control Description: Cables protected from interception, interference or damage.

Title: Equipment maintenance
Control Description: Equipment maintained to ensure availability, integrity, confidentiality.

Title: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
Control Description: Sensitive data and licensed software must be verified as removed before disposal or reuse.

Title: User end point devices
Control Description: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.

Title: Privileged access rights
Control Description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.

Title: Information access restriction
Control Description: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.

Title: Access to source code
Control Description: Read and write access to source code, development tools and software libraries shall be appropriately managed.

Title: Secure authentication
Control Description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be implemented based on access restrictions and topic-specific policy.

Title: Capacity management
Control Description: The use of resources shall be monitored and adjusted according to current and expected capacity requirements.

Title: Protection against malware
Control Description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.

Title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
Control Description: Organizations shall assess and address technical vulnerabilities of systems in use.

Title: Configuration management
Control Description: Configurations of hardware, software, and networks shall be securely defined, monitored and reviewed.

Title: Information deletion
Control Description: Information stored in systems or media shall be deleted when no longer needed.
References: NIS_Compliance_Security_Guidelines_for_OES.pdf (Appendix B - Protect, Data Lifecycle), OJ_L_202500302_EN_TXT.pdf (Annex I)

Title: Data masking
Control Description: Data masking shall follow access control policies and business/legal requirements.

Title: Data leakage prevention
Control Description: Data leakage prevention measures shall protect systems and networks handling sensitive data.
References: NIS_Compliance_Security_Guidelines_for_OES.pdf (Appendix B - Data Security), OJ_L_202500302_EN_TXT.pdf (Annex I Template)

Title: Information backup
Control Description: Backup of data and systems shall be maintained and tested regularly.

Title: Redundancy of information processing facilities
Control Description: Redundancy shall be implemented to ensure system availability.

Title: Logging
Control Description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, and events shall be produced, stored, protected, and analyzed.

Title: Monitoring activities
Control Description: Networks, systems, and applications shall be monitored for anomalous behavior; actions must be taken to evaluate incidents.

Title: Clock synchronization
Control Description: Clocks of systems must be synchronized to approved time sources.

Title: Use of privileged utility programs
Control Description: Use of utility programs that override controls must be restricted and tightly controlled.

Title: Installation of software on operational systems
Control Description: Procedures must ensure secure management of software installation on systems.

Title: Networks security
Control Description: Network devices and infrastructure must be secured, managed, and controlled to protect system information.

Title: Security of network services
Control Description: Security mechanisms and levels for network services must be identified, implemented, and monitored.

Title: Segregation of networks
Control Description: Groups of services, users, and systems shall be segregated in the network.

Title: Web filtering
Control Description: Access to external websites shall be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content.

Title: Use of cryptography
Control Description: Rules for cryptographic controls (e.g., key management) shall be defined and implemented.

Title: Secure development life cycle
Control Description: Secure development rules shall be established and applied for software and systems.

Title: Application security requirements
Control Description: Information security requirements must be defined and approved for application development/acquisition.

Title: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
Control Description: Secure design principles shall be applied and documented.

Title: Secure coding
Control Description: Secure coding principles shall be enforced.

Title: Security testing in development and acceptance
Control Description: Security testing shall be defined and implemented across the development life cycle.

Title: Outsourced development
Control Description: Outsourced development must be directed, monitored, and reviewed by the organization.

Title: Separation of development, test and production environments
Control Description: Development, test, and production environments shall be separated and secured.

Title: Change management
Control Description: All changes to information systems shall follow a change management procedure.

Title: Test information
Control Description: Test data shall be securely managed and protected.

Title: Protection of information systems during audit testing
Control Description: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems shall be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management.
